data.text: It was very good experience with Otel Balca. They are communicative, helpful, budget friendly and facilities are great as well. Location is simply amazing and you can reach to anywhere you want in Izmir easily. Simply recommended go and enjoy It.!
data.title: Great Stuff and Facilities, Perfect Location

data.text:
I consIder this hotel is better for couples which want to pay less and stay in the city centre (near to the sea, but not sea view)

The reception team is not working professionally, however their kindness and efforts to help the guests made me forget about professionality.

Izmir is a touristic city and particularly very noisy at nights (especially in summer) and while sleeping you may hear loud voices from the nearby cafes.

While checking in try to give their official reservation confirmation letter, because of not having a payment problem after checking out (it happened with me, but I tackled the issue).

Rooms and bathroom are clean and you may use the facilities properly, as well as rooms are designed well.

In this hotel WI FI is also problematic. Because of using the qualitative internet I had to sit on the floor and this is not good for this hotel.

If you want to pay less and spend your most time near the sea you may choose Hotel Balca.

Breakfast is also typical Turkish meals which I have seen in Istanbul as well. (Good).
data.title: Good hotel for couples

data.text:
Hotel Balca, pronounced bal ja, is perfect for the price and couldn't be a better location. The hosts were very kind and accommodating. Absolutely love Turkish breakfasts, coffee and chai! 

Alsancak, Kordon is the coolest neighborhood. Right outside of the hotel in either direction are loads of wonderful restaurants, and the cutest street side cafes. There's so many it will be hard to choose where to go. 

Short walk to shopping and the waterfront with loads of more restaurants and cafes. Also, very conveniently located. If coming in via airport take the train straight to Alsancak station and you're about a 5min walk to the hotel! ‚ù§Ô∏è

Also, if you're visiting on a Sunday there's a cool street side market about a block away. 

Te≈üekk√ºrler T√ºrkiye üáπüá∑
data.title: Perfect location!

data.text:
Location - great, right in the centre of Alsancak.  Amazingly, the SatNav found the hotel which is in the small winding back streets.  The hotel doesn't have parking - we were able to park outside the hotel on the street overnight but had to move it early next morning.  There is parking closeby. 

Everything is in walking distance.  It seems a fairly safe area. We walked to the Kordon (seafront) and there are lots and lots of places to eat and drink.

Hotel doesn't have a lift which proved a bit of a problem as we had lots of luggage.  Breakfast was v basic Turkish - nothing special.

Rooms had aircon, wifi and fridge with free water.  Room was small and bathroom v small but shower was ok. However, we were only staying 1 night. 

Recommend for a v short stay.
data.title: Good for a short stay
